p: The data presented in Table 3 showed that b* value increased significantly ( p < .05) with increasing the DbE concentration. So, the F9 and F6 had the highest and lowest b* value, respectively. b* value indicates a yellow‐blue color and a positive b* value indicated that the formulae had a yellow tint. By increasing the concentration of DbE, the brightness and redness of the developed films decreased and their yellowness increased due to the yellow nature of the DbE. Also, a* and L* values of the developed films decreased significantly ( p < .05).
